did.head: Collection Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 3 manuscript boxes, 1 cubic foot box, 1 phonotape, 3 flags

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, office files, propaganda, miscellanea, sound recordings, flags, and memorabilia, relating to national socialism in Germany. Includes photocopies of documents located at the U.S. Berlin Document Center, relating to Nazi party activities and to Heinrich Himmler; recordings of speeches by Adolf Hitler, Joseph Goebbels, Robert Ley, and Heinrich Himmler, and of Nazi loyalty oaths and other ceremonies; a propaganda placard series, entitled Wochenspruch der NSDAP; miscellaneous party application and registration forms; and World War II Nazi battle flags.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nationalsozialistische deutsche Arbeiter-Partei miscellaneous records, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, office files, propaganda, miscellanea, sound recordings, flags, and memorabilia, relating to national socialism in Germany. Includes photocopies of documents located at the U.S. Berlin Document Center, relating to Nazi party activities and to Heinrich Himmler; recordings of speeches by Adolf Hitler, Joseph Goebbels, Robert Ley, and Heinrich Himmler, and of Nazi loyalty oaths and other ceremonies; a propaganda placard series, entitled Wochenspruch der NSDAP; miscellaneous party application and registration forms; and World War II Nazi battle flags.

Photocopies in Boxes 1-2 correspond to listing for Reel B in the published guide, Grete Heinz and Agnes F. Peterson, comp., NSDAP Hauptarchiv : Guide to the Hoover Institution Microfilm Collection (Stanford: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace, 1964)

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: National socialism.
Propaganda, German.
World War, 1939-1945--Germany.

did.unittitle: Sound recording of Nazi speeches and events

scopecontent.p: One roll of audiotape containg excerpts of speeches and recordings of events from tapes acquired in Germany (Archiv Peterle).
Part 1:
1. Speech of Joseph Goebbels, May 1, 1933
2. Speech of Joseph Goebbels on the occasion of the burning of the books (F.W. Foerster, Siegmund Freud, Erich Remarque)
3. Speech of Adolf Hitler in the Reichstag, justifying the execution of S.A. membrs on June 30, 1934
4. Loyalty oath, to the Fuhrer by army officers (the first speaker is Witzleben), 1934
5. Celebration of Tempelhofer Feld, May 1, 1934
6. Loyalty oath of Hitlerjugend on the Bueckelberg, also Baldur von Schirach
7. New religion, religious ceremonies
8. Rally of workers on Tempelhofer Feld in 1936, addressed by Robert Ley and Goebbels
Part 2:
1. Speech of Robert Ley before workers in Essen, 1943
2. Speech of Joseph Goebbels (Wir konnen jetzt die Welt erobern: wir wollen uns endlich einmal an den Fettnapf der Welt setzen)
3. Speech of Adolf Hitler on Ausnahmegesetze
4. Speech of Robert Ley on Rassentheorie.
5. Speech of Joseph Goebbels in Sportpalast 1943 (Das Abendland ist in Gefahr)
6. Speech of Robert Ley (Der Jude ist die grosse Gafahr der Menschheit)
7. Speech of Heinrich Himmler before S.S. officers in Posen 1944 (?)
8. Speech of Joseph Goebbels in Sportpalast 1944 (Wollt Ihr den totalen Krieg?)

did.unittitle: Rest of collection not yet described
